snippet.title: Atheist Experience 23.25 with Matt Dillahunty & Eric Murphy
snippet.description:
4:45 RAO: WY: You Worship Your Own Virtues and Deify Them, Worship
18:58 Cory: NY: Do You Think God Owes You Proof?
23:35 Patrick: OH: Irrefutable Proof, “Acts 2:38 Experience”, Speaking in Tongues, Evolution
46:15 Ryan: FL: What Would Convince You That God Exists?, Slavery in the Bible
1:03:00 Dave: MO: Testimonial Evidence, Biblical Prophecies 
1:16:25 Brandon: AZ: Slavery, Joseph’s Tomb Found
1:19:30 Drake: FL: Cult Deprogramming, 
1:38:40 Adrian: TX: Examples of Creation, Design, How Do We Know God is an Option?
1:49:30 Traci: AR: The Power of Weather and God

The Atheist Experience episode 23.25 for June 16, 2019, with Matt Dillahunty and Eric Murphy. Viewer calls. Matt and Eric take calls.

Call the show on Sundays 4-6pm CT: 1-512-686-0279 or use our green call the show button to save on long-distance charges: http://www.atheist-experience.com/

Don't like commercials? Become a Patron and enjoy ad-free content: https://www.patreon.com/TheAtheistExperience/

-------

WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly call-in television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

VISIT THE ACA'S OFFICIAL WEB SITES

► http://www.atheist-community.org (The Atheist Community of Austin)
► http://www.atheist-experience.com (The Atheist Experience TV Show)

More shows and video clips can be found in the archive:
► http://www.atheist-experience.com/archive

DVDs of the Atheist Experience can be purchased via:
► http://www.atheist-community.com/products

NOTES

TheAtheistExperience is the official channel of The Atheist Experience. "The Atheist Experience" is a trademark of the ACA.

The views and opinions expressed by hosts, guests, or callers are their own and not necessarily representative of the Atheist Community of Austin.

WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly call-in television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

VISIT THE ACA'S OFFICIAL WEB SITES

► http://www.atheist-community.org (The Atheist Community of Austin)
► http://www.atheist-experience.com (The Atheist Experience TV Show)

More shows and video clips can be found in the archive:
► http://www.atheist-experience.com/archive

DVDs of the Atheist Experience can be purchased via:
► http://www.atheist-community.com/products

NOTES

TheAtheistExperience is the official channel of The Atheist Experience. "The Atheist Experience" is a trademark of the ACA.

The views and opinions expressed by hosts, guests, or callers are their own and not necessarily representative of the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Experience 22.39 September 30, 2018 with Tracie Harris and Don Baker. Standing up for sitting down. Don talks about a Texas high school student expelled for not standing for the pledge. We will be streaming our new show Secular Sexuality right here, so stay tuned after AXP.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

Don't like commercials? Become a Patron and enjoy ad-free content: https://www.patreon.com/theatheistexperience/

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

16:25 John: FL: Asking Theists to After Show Dinner, Is Abortion a Moral Right?

1:19:45 Dylan: Chicago, IL: Coming Out Atheist to Parents

1:32:25 Amanda: Cheyenne, WY: Am I Being Misleading by Talking to Mormons?
1:46:00 Isaac: OK: Why the Gospels Were Written by Eyewitnesses
1:57:35 Jessi: Queens, NY: Atheism and Feminism

The Atheist Experience 22.27 July 8, 2018 with Tracie Harris and Jen Peeples.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

Don't like commercials? Become a Patron and enjoy ad-free content: https://www.patreon.com/theatheistexperience/

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

localized.description:
25:30 McKinley: GA: The Bible, Prophecy, and Truth
34:00 Steve: UK: Was Matt Ever a True Christian, Biblical Prophecies
44:45 Zach: Hagerman, ID: Euthyphro Dilemma, Why Caller Wishes God Were Real
1:03:15 Rick: Ann Arbor, MI: Testing Out a Cosmological Argument
1:14:00 Richard: Toronto, Canada: Animal Rights

The Atheist Experience episode 22.03 for January 21, 2018, with Matt Dillahunty and Don Baker. Lingering opp. to gay marriage. Don talks about Chris Sevier, one of many trying to stop same-sex marriage.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

snippet.title: Atheist Experience 21.50 with Jen Peeples and Clare Wuellner
snippet.description:
38:45 Cory: New York, NY: Morality of Animals vs Humans
48:30 John: Johnson City, TN: The Ethicacy of Zoos
51:57 David: Minneapolis, MN: The Argument from Reason
1:07:40 Karl: Vista, CA: Religion’s Evolutionary Advantages
1:19:37 Amed: Islamabad, Pakistan: Truth and Science in the Koran

The Atheist Experience episode 21.50 for December 31, 2017, with Jen Peeples and Clare Wuellner. Science Education. Clare talks about the state of science education in Texas with a focus on biology.

New Years Eve Evolution Difficulties Special!

Supplemental Links:

Evolution is a fact:
http://www.nas.edu/evolution/TheoryOrFact.html
https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/just-a-theory-7-misused-science-words/
http://www.talkorigins.org/faqs/evolution-fact.html

Primate evolution:
https://www.sciencealert.com/new-fossil-discovery-just-changed-everything-we-thought-about-our-last-common-ape-ancestor

Denisovan/Primate DNA
https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/tiny-genetic-differences-between-humans-and-other-primates-pervade-the-genome/
http://ajendu.blogspot.com/2013/07/hybridization-hypothesis-origin-of.html

Hillis et alia Tree of Life
http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-14616161

Naked mole rat---one wacky rodent (Order Rodentia):
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naked_mole-rat

Theory of Mind in Horses:  
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4780548/

Horse Pain Scale (visible pain expression in horses):  
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4312484/
http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0092281

Non-human animal emotion:
https://academic.oup.com/bioscience/article/50/10/861/233998

Non-human farming in animals:
https://www.asm.org/index.php/general-science-blog/item/6839-the-leaf-cutter-ant-s-50-million-years-of-farming
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant%E2%80%93fungus_mutualism

Tool use in non-human animals:
http://science.sciencemag.org/content/306/5703/1903

27:45 Tim: Phoenix, AZ: Best Arguments for Creationism and How to Refute Them
34:13 John: San Diego, CA: Frequent Caller Chuck From Hawaii Gets Dropped
35:11 Larry: Cedar Park, TX: Why Do The Show When You Don’t Convert Any Callers?
41:38 Matt: NC: First Commandment Proves God Is Opposed to Slavery
59:41 Dana: Hernando, FL: Update on Dana’s Family Drama
1:11:10 Melissa: Brooklyn, NY: When Did Tracie Realize She Was an Atheist?
1:14:00 John: IN: Troll/Joke Call
1:14:45 Drew: NC: How to Deal with Theist Family Members on Thanksgiving
1:21:05 Audience Question: Sandy: Concord, CA: How to Stop Christian Friend Witnessing
1:28:30 Audience Question: MD: How to Effectively Communicate Science to Religious People
1:32:00 Hugh: Chicago, IL: Was Hitler the Second Coming of Christ, (Troll Call)

The Atheist Experience episode 21.45 for November 19, 2017, with Tracie Harris and Don Baker. The Gift. Don dissects the alleged gift offered in John 3:16.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/


WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly call-in television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

VISIT THE ACA'S OFFICIAL WEB SITES

► http://www.atheist-community.org (The Atheist Community of Austin)
► http://www.atheist-experience.com (The Atheist Experience TV Show)

► http://www.atheist-experience.com/archive

► http://www.atheist-community.com/products

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

15:45 Brian: Dundee, Scotland: Ex-Atheists

46:15 Ray Blevins: One of the Original Hosts of the Atheist Experience Calls In

1:07:25 Tim: San Francisco, CA: How Do You Justify Eating Meat
1:21:06 Luke: Orlando, FL: Ex Muslim Responds to Previous Caller Parker

The Atheist Experience 21.41 for October 22, 2017 with Russell Glasser and Ciera Ramirez. Viewer Calls. Russell and Ciera take callers. The 20th Anniversary Special Episode will be published separately.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

1:40:20 Tristan: Dearborn, MI: The Problem with Islam
1:44:10 John: Chicago, IL: Solipsism

The Atheist Experience episode 21.28 for July 16, 2017, with Tracie Harris and Don Baker. The Failure of Revelation. Don discusses the failure of revealed truth.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

snippet.title: Atheist Experience 21.18 with Matt Dillahunty and Don Baker
snippet.description:
18:45 Corey: NY: Criteria to Convince You of the Existence of God
22:23 Daniel: IN: The Only Deist in Indiana
32:15 Nick: VA: Why Were You a Christian, Without God No Justice
1:02:35 Gaurav: Bangalore, India: Christians Confusing Justice with Revenge
1:13:50 Tom: Clearwater, FL: Am I an Atheist or Agnostic
1:23:03 John: Topeka, KS: Burden of Proof

The Atheist Experience episode 21.18 for May 7, 2017, with Matt Dillahunty and Don Baker. Explaining Too Much. Don describes how, by explaining everything, the concept of God explains nothing at all.

Call the show on Sundays 4:00-6:00pm CDT: 1-512-686-0279

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

snippet.title: Atheist Experience 21.05 with Matt Dillahunty and John Iacoletti
snippet.description:
5:15 Scott: Seattle, WA: World Must Have a Creator
33:05 Kim: Nashville, TN: Atheist Televangelist Junkie and Also a Christian
50:55 Jonathan: Israel: Irony of Religious Exemptions from Military Service in Israel
1:11:10 Bailey: Minooka, IL: How Did You Get Started in Atheist Activism
1:23:25 Andrew: RI: Why Don’t You Believe, Evidence for God (Repeat Caller)

The Atheist Experience episode 21.05 for February 5, 2017, with Matt Dillahunty and John Iacoletti. Pulpit and Politics. Matt discusses Trump's recent claim of changing the law to allow churches to endorse candidates.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:

The Atheist Experience episode 21.01 for January 8, 2017 with Matt Dillahunty and Phil Session. Lackland AFB Atheist Group. Phil talks about an atheist group at the Lackland AFB and the topic of the day, dealing with death.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. The Atheist Experience episode 20.43 for October 30, 2016, with Russell Glasser and Tracie Harris. Predicting the Future. Tracie dissects two stories about predicting the future and finds confirmation  bias.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

snippet.title: Atheist Experience 20.39 with Russell Glasser and Jen Peeples
snippet.description:
17:00 Carl: Washington, DC: Violence in Old Testament (troll call)
18:43 Andrew: Findlay, OH: Finding Motivation as an Atheist
33:15 Jacob: Chattanooga, TN: Craig’s Fine Tuning Argument
52:30 Abul: Bangalore, India: Responding to Nihilism, Absurdism
1:02:40 Raymond: Mesa, AZ: Agnostic Label Doesn’t Make Sense, Definitions of Terms
1:22:43 Ankh: Atlanta, GA: Christianity Taking Advantage of Black Community
1:30:10 Pabish: Mumbai, India: (will call next time)
1:30:25 Peter: Charlottesville, VA: What Argument Infuriates You Most?

The Atheist Experience episode 20.39 for October 2, 2016, with Russell Glasser and Jen Peeples. Vaccinations. Jen addresses some misconceptions about vaccines.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

The Atheist Experience episode 20.35 for September 4, 2016, with Russell Glasser and Phil Session. Viewer Calls. Russell and Phil take viewer calls.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

snippet.title: Atheist Experience 20.25 with Matt Dillahunty and Phil Session
snippet.description:
16:40 Ron: Chicago, IL: Intelligent Design, Evolution, Common Descent
38:20 Jasper: Dawsonwood, GA: Why Don’t You Believe, Bible Must Be True Due to Size (troll)
41:40 Sam: Virginia Beach, VA: Knowledge vs Belief, Choosing Beliefs, Faith vs Reason
53:45 Tai: Los Angeles, CA: Relationship Advice, Skeptic with Buddhist GF
1:01:35 Marcus: San Diego, CA: Islam Hate, Islamic Apologist
1:25:20 Phil: Phoenix, AZ: Does Matt Believe There Is No God?
1:32:20 David: Biloxi, MS: Delusions and Hallucinations, Religion isn’t a Mental Illness

The Atheist Experience 20.25 for June 26, 2016, with Matt Dillahunty and Phil Session.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/


WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly call-in television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

VISIT THE ACA'S OFFICIAL WEB SITES

► http://www.atheist-community.org (The Atheist Community of Austin)
► http://www.atheist-experience.com (The Atheist Experience TV Show)

More shows and video clips can be found in the archive:
► http://www.atheist-experience.com/archive

DVDs of the Atheist Experience can be purchased via:
► http://www.atheist-community.org/products

NOTES

TheAtheistExperience is the official channel of The Atheist Experience. "The Atheist Experience" is a trademark of the ACA.

The Atheist Experience episode 20.12 for March 27, 2016 with Matt Dillahunty and Tracie Harris. ISIS Bombings. How Islam is making the world a better place through bombings.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

The Atheist Experience episode 20.03 for January 17, 2016, with Russell Glasser and Neil Carter. Godless in Dixie. Neil Carter talks about his experiences as an out atheist in Mississippi.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly cable access television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. 32:30 Guy: Windsor, Ontario: Definition of Godhood, Conceptualizations
57:35 Elizabeth: England: Ghost Stories, Argument from Ignorance, Priming Beliefs
1:17:10 Dan: Las Vegas, NV: Raising Kids with Religious Spouse
1:26:25 Joseph: Indianapolis, IN: Atheist Living with Religious Grandparents, Going to Church

The Atheist Experience #935 for September 13, 2015, with Tracie Harris and John Iacoletti. Religious Rights? Tracie and John talk about the alleged conflict between people's religious "rights" vs others' rights.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly cable access television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.

VISIT THE ACA'S OFFICIAL WEB SITES

► http://www.atheist-community.org (The Atheist Community of Austin)
► http://www.atheist-experience.com (The Atheist Experience TV Show)

More shows and video clips can be found in the archive:
► http://www.atheist-experience.com/archive

DVDs of the Atheist Experience can be purchased via:
► http://www.atheist-community.org/products

NOTES

TheAtheistExperience is the official channel of The Atheist Experience. "The Atheist Experience" is a trademark of the ACA.

1:04:45 Addison: UK: Favorite Magic Trick That Emulates a Religious Miracle

The Atheist Experience #930 for August 9, 2015, with Matt Dillahunty and John Iacoletti. Viewer Calls. Matt and John take callers via Skype.

We welcome your comments on the open blog thread for this show. 
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

YouTube comments are at present disabled in our channel, to the displeasure of some. However, each video has a prominent link to the associated open thread that appears on our blog. In the past we've tried opening up the channel to comments, but we found that a very high number of episodes wound up being flooded with a combination of spam, long winded apologists, and various obscene or misogynistic comments directed at various hosts by people with an axe to grind. This seems to be the nature of YouTube comment sections, in our experience.

We do moderate the blog, the same way that we moderate chat during the show, as well as comments on our Facebook group. For comment sections that are "officially" associated with our show (and, to a much lesser extent, channels that may give the unintended appearance of being official), we prefer not to play host to straight up ad hominem attacks and bigotry. As a general policy we do not block commenters simply on the basis of disagreement with our point of view. However, we do prefer discussion environments that don't actively chase off more reasonable contributors.

-------

The most up to date Atheist Experience videos can be found by visiting http://atheist-experience.com/archive/

You can read more about this show on the Atheist Experience blog:
► http://freethoughtblogs.com/axp/

WHAT IS THE ATHEIST EXPERIENCE?

The Atheist Experience is a weekly cable access television show in Austin, Texas geared at a non-atheist audience. The Atheist Experience is produced by the Atheist Community of Austin.

The Atheist Community of Austin is organized as a nonprofit educational corporation to develop and support the atheist community, to provide opportunities for socializing and friendship, to promote secular viewpoints, to encourage positive atheist culture, to defend the first amendment principle of state-church separation, to oppose discrimination against atheists and to work with other organizations in pursuit of common goals.

We define atheism as the lack of belief in gods. This definition also encompasses what most people call agnosticism.


VISIT THE ACA'S OFFICIAL WEB SITES

► http://www.atheist-community.org (The Atheist Community of Austin)
► http://www.atheist-experience.com (The Atheist Experience TV Show)

More shows and video clips can be found in the archive:
► http://www.atheist-experience.com/archive

DVDs of the Atheist Experience can be purchased via:
► http://www.atheist-community.org/products


MUSIC CREDITS

Theme song: "Listen to Reason," written and performed by Bryan Steeksma.
► http://www.youtube.com/bryansteeksma
► http://www.myspace.com/bryansteeksma
